Column1: Shankar to Zampa, out Bowled!! Vijay Shankar has done it! This is India's 500th ODI win. The umpires wanted to check if it was a fair delivery, no problems whatsoever. He bowls the perfect delivery. Slips in a yorker right in the blockhole and a backing away Zampa can't jam it out. Crashes into middle-stump. India win by 8 runs! Zampa b Shankar 2(2)
Shankar to Zampa, 2 runs, Zampa moves leg-side and pats this length ball to the right of point, where Rohit dives and takes the pace off the ball. The batters collect a double because of that

Shankar to Stoinis, out Lbw!! Wow! Stoinis has been adjudged lbw. And Stoinis has to review that. He does. Legal delivery. A seam-up delivery and Stoinis missed the heave. Hit him on the back leg adjacent to the sticks. Was there any bat involved? Nothing on UltraEdge. Over to HawkEye, now. Umpire's call on hitting wickets. The on-field call of umpire Nitin Menon stays. Stoinis is absolutely distraught. What drama here at Nagpur! Stoinis wanted to play a big heave and got done in by this in-slanter from a length. The impact was on middle and ball-tracking showed it to be clipping leg-stump. Stoinis lbw b Shankar 52(65) [4s-4 6s-1]

Shami to Lyon, FOUR, this is bonus for Australia. Shami dishes out a full toss on leg, Lyon clears his front leg to hoick across the line and gets a thick inside edge that runs away fine and into the fine leg fence
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, Stoinis backs away and Shami follows him with a pacy back of a length delivery at 139.2kph. Stoinis is cramped for room and he can only drag it to long-on
Shami to Lyon, 1 run, Shami bowls length and that's been cut hard to deep point
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, Stoinis walks forward and across to work this short of length delivery to square leg. Gives the strike to Lyon

Shami to Stoinis, 2 runs, just out of square leg's reach. An uppish, wristy flick to a back of a length and the ball evaded a leaping Kuldeep to his left. Stoinis comes back for the second and notches up a fifty! He won't be too bothered about his milestone at this moment
Shami to Stoinis, no run, short of a good length ball, Stoinis shimmies down and punches it back towards the bowler
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, a single off the final ball of the over. A short of a good length ball, Stoinis walks towards off and nudges it to square leg. Another good outing for Bumrah: 10-0-29-2

Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, that was so close to the outside edge! Good length delivery that nibbles away ever so lightly, Stoinis was looking for another defensive push, missed the outside nick by a whisker
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 140.8kph, short of length delivery, blocked into the off-side
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 140.5kph, yorker, Stoinis squeezes it out to backward point and Lyon comes out of his crease. The fielder is Jadeja who mocks a throw at the bowler's end
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 135.7kph, good length delivery, Stoinis prods across and defends it towards mid-off. Seems, the plan is to see off Bumrah
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 137.9kph, in-slanter, Stoinis knocks it straight down the ground. Mid-off moves to his right to mop that up. Another single denied
Shami to Lyon, no run, 139.5kph, in-curling yorker and Lyon brings his bat down and manages to get an inside edge that rolls to fine leg. Single not taken!
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, Stoinis uses the bowler's pace and width to run it down to third man

Shami to Stoinis, FOUR, slight width on offer and Stoinis takes full toll of it. He stays leg-side of the ball and cuts this shortish ball beating backward point to his left. No chance for Bumrah (third man) to cut that off
Shami to Stoinis, no run, stump-to-stump line ball, blocked back to the bowler

Shami to Lyon, 1 run, sloppy from India. Lyon pokes this length ball to backward point and Kedar has a shy at the sticks at the striker's end. Missed the target and Rayudu (the backing up fielder) fumbled. That allows the batters to rotate strike
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, now he's decided to take the single. Strange tactics. Fullish ball on the stumps, Stoinis walks across to glance it to deep mid-wicket
Bumrah to Lyon, no run, well, Stoinis has decided not to take a run. Lyon got an outside edge on this drive and the ball went down to third man. Just 1 run and 2 wickets off that over!

Bumrah to Lyon, no run, 131.8kph, back of a length delivery, seam-up delivery that leaves the right-hander, Lyon pokes and gets beaten on the outside edge. An optimistic appeal from Bumrah, Dhoni and the crowd

Bumrah to Pat Cummins, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni appeals, umpire Nitin Menon has a word with his partner and decides to go upstairs. The soft signal is OUT! Legal ball. That's a clean catch. Pat Cummins departs for a 2-ball duck. Australia have lost their eighth wicket, they still need 28 runs to win. This guy - Bumrah - is incredible at the death overs. And, he's showing it why, again! A pacy short of length delivery marginally outside off and Cummins had a poke at it, without any major feet movement. He got a faint outside edge and Dhoni took a sharp, low catch. Dhoni was late to appeal and that might have created a doubt in the umpire's mind. Pat Cummins c Dhoni b Bumrah 0(2)
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, 139.9kph, full ball on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler

Bumrah to Coulter-Nile, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. 142.6kph! Bumrah attacks the stumps from a good length, nipped in a bit off the deck. A mediocre stroke from Coulter-Nile. Against a straight ball, he was trying to cut. Neither the length was short, nor the line was wide. He missed it and the ball made a mess of the timber. India fighting back, here! Coulter-Nile b Bumrah 4(4)
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, 141.5kph, in-angling length ball, Stoinis opens the bat-face and dinks it down to third man

Kuldeep Yadav to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs, Coulter-Nile decides to slog this full tossed up ball across the line. Doesn't middle it and the ball goes up in the air. Luckily for the batsman, the ball lands between the two men in the deep (long-on and deep mid-wicket). Rayudu slides to his right and parries it to Vijay Shankar. Kuldeep - 10-0-54-3
Kuldeep Yadav to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs, that's a decent shot from Coulter-Nile. Touch short from Kuldeep, Coulter-Nile went back and lifted it over extra cover. Long-off mops up
Kuldeep Yadav to Coulter-Nile, no run, flighted delivery, googly, not sure if the batter picked that. He had decided to block, the ball hits the bat and dies down on the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, out Bowled!! No major celebrations from the Indians. Loads of flight on this full ball and Kuldeep got it to drift in a bit. Carey went through with his premeditated sweep shot and ended up dragging it onto his stumps - courtesy an under edge. Carey b Kuldeep Yadav 22(24) [4s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, 1 run, slower delivery - 78.9kph, spinning into the pads, helped on its way to deep square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, FOUR, poor from Kuldeep Yadav. Tries to bowl the quicker one - 101.7kph, but errs in line and length. Short and wide outside off, Stoinis stands tall and slaps it through backward point
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, Shami slips in a full toss and Stoinis is happy to drive it down to long-on. Six balls, six singles in this over
Shami to Carey, 1 run, off-pace short ball, Carey pulls hard, straight to deep mid-wicket
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, to cover, 136.3kph, not much roon on offer on this short of length delivery, with an angled bat Stoinis manages to pat it towards cover
Shami to Carey, 1 run, pitched up delivery, Carey wrists the drive to long-on

Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, loud shot for lbw, the umpire shakes his head in denial. A skiddy length short of length seam-up delivery, Stoinis is cramped for room. Tries to work it through the leg-side and I'm not sure if there was an inside edge there. Height was another factor going against the fielding side
Shami to Carey, 1 run, 132.4kph, short of length delivery marginally outside off from round the wicket, steered to third man
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, no run, 81.8kph, very full and that's been squeezed back to the bowler

Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, SIX, 15 off the over with a ball to go! Good use of the feet from Stoinis. Comes down the track, gets close to the pitch of the leggie and hoists it over long-on. High and handsome
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, 1 run, Kuldeep drags his length tad too short and Carey cuts this well in front of square, Vijay Shankar is swift to mop that up. Keeps the batters down to a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, FOUR, powerful stroke! Slower through the air, fuller on this occasion, Carey gets down on a knee and smashes it through the mid-wicket region with a sweep shot
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, no run, short again, Kuldeep gets away as Carey finds backward point with his cut shot

Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, FOUR, good shot! Not a great ball from Kuldeep Yadav, tad short with loads of width outside off. Carey rocks back on seeing that and scythes it fiercely behind square on the off-side. A desperate dive from Vijay Shankar in the deep to his right, but in vain
Bumrah to Carey, 1 run, Carey hops and opens his bat-face to tap this short of length delivery towards cover for a quick single. Another tight over - just 3 off it

Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, 137.9kph, in-slanter, Stoinis gets beaten for pace as well as the angle. Missed the glance and rolled towards point off his body. Given as runs, but replays show that there was no inside edge
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 140.2kph, length ball around off, a miscued punch to cover follows

Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, 137.1kph, fullish ball, a seam-up delivery that didn't bounce much. Stoinis is beaten on the outside edge as he tries to drive away from his body. No feet movement there from Stoinis
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, length ball, punched to cover
Bumrah to Carey, 1 run, 140kph, skiddy back of a length delivery from round the wicket, Carey gets inside the line of it and tickles it to fine leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, 1 run, Kuldeep goes full on this occasion and Carey manages to get some wood with his sweep shot. Rolls to long leg. Just 3 runs off that over
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, no run, turning away from the left-hander, cut straight to backward point
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, 2 runs, slower through the air, Carey gets down to broom it away to backward square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, no run, tad short, Carey miscues the cut to cover. It would have been a wide had he let go

Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, no run, an appeal for lbw, turned down. Did that hit the pad first? Yes, but the impact was wide of off. The non-turner and Carey was late on his block. Umpire's call on impact (marginally outside off) and missing off - according to HawkEye
Kuldeep Yadav to Carey, no run, tossed up delivery, Carey tries to play the premeditated sweep shot, spun a bit as well. Hits the toe-end and died down on the pitch
Bumrah to Carey, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, cuts it to deep point
Bumrah to Carey, no run, back of a length delivery on off, blocked into the covers
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, cramps him up with the in-ducker and Stoinis drags it off a thick inside edge onto the pad. They go through for the single as the ball rolls away into the off-side
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, short of length on off, no room, Stoinis blocks
Bumrah to Carey, 1 run, short of length delivery just outside off, rides the bounce nicely and dabs it wide of Jadeja at backward point, who manages to get a hand diving to his wrong side
Bumrah to Carey, no run, full ball just outside off, skewed off the inside half into the on-side
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, 2 runs, pretty slow through the air around off, Stoinis uses all the pace that it has and reverse-paddles it for a couple. Got it fine enough to beat the fielder
Kedar Jadhav to Carey, 1 run, skidding in on middle, Carey punches it down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Carey, no run, back of a length delivery sliding through outside off, punches it to short cover
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, 1 run, that's agonizingly low from Jadhav. Short ball outside off, yet it gets only up around the ankles. Stoinis somehow cuts it through point
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, bit further up this time, Stoinis cuts it to the fielder

Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, FOUR, Jadhav drops it short outside off again, maybe will have to rethink from where he's delivering the ball, which is from behind the stumps. Stoinis slaps it through the cover field
Shami to Carey, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on leg stump, clipped nicely through midwicket by Carey to get off the mark
Shami to Carey, wide, down the leg-side this time, an area where Shami has been rather off today - his discipline
Shami to Carey, no run, slower ball on middle, defended to short extra cover
Shami to Stoinis, 1 run, short and wide, Stoinis slaps it through to sweeper cover

Shami to Handscomb, out Handscomb Run Out!! Not smart, not smart at all. Jadeja's the last person you want to be taking a risky single against. Good length around off, stabbed in front of backward point. Handscomb hesitates, as he should, but then rather than sending his partner back, he obliges. The bounce is favourable for Jadeja, it's his favourable left hand too and he's right on target with the rocket throw, as he so often is. Completely unnecessary from Australia. Handscomb run out (Jadeja) 48(59) [4s-4]

Shami to Handscomb, FOUR, full ball slanted in on middle, Handscomb keeps his shape, doesn't overhit which can be seen in how little flourish there is with the bat, and just lifts it over midwicket. All he was looking to do was clear the infield. The timing took care of the rest
Shami to Handscomb, no run, cuts back in slightly from a good length and Handscomb mistimes the drive off the inside half to mid-on

Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, FOUR, this time Stoinis stayed right back in the crease, even made some room for himself by backing away and crashed this through the off-side ring. Only had to beat the infield as there was no one protecting the boundary
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, bowling from well behind the crease here, and so Stoinis isn't able to get to the length as he advances. Punches it back
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 1 run, reverse-swipes this flighted delivery to short third man

Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 2 runs, that's well played by Handscomb, using a reverse-paddle to get this leg-stump delivery fine of backward point. But with Jadhav providing so little pace, it's never going to reach the boundary
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, length ball skidding through around off, Handscomb leans back and chops it to short extra cover
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, sliding through from a length on middle, turned to midwicket
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, swept to deep square leg. Jadeja finishes with figures of 1/48. Safe to say India would've expected more out of him on this surface

Jadeja to Handscomb, FOUR, he gets the sweep away this time, and nails it in the gap. Fetches the ball from outside off and shovels it through backward square. Jadeja gets a bit of a scolding from Dhoni about the faster pace that he's bowling at

Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, enough purchase for Jadeja to beat Handscomb's attempted sweep. Wanted to fetch that from outside off, a difficult proposition as it is, and wasn't helped by the turn on it
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, steps out, takes this on the full and whips it down to long-on
Jadeja to Handscomb, leg byes, 1 run, darted in on middle and leg, beats Handscomb on the sweep and strikes the pad. Would've missed leg stump

Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, such a risky shot to play against Jadeja who keeps it straight most of the time. Skidding into off stump from round the wicket, Handscomb makes room to cut but gets cramped up and just about chops it away
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, works this length ball to square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, short and wide outside off, poor delivery really, but Stoinis slaps it straight to cover-point
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, wide, down the leg-side from Jadhav, Stoinis doesn't get anything on it
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, clips it to midwicket

Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, Stoinis has a big laugh about this, but it can't hide how he's struggling. Back of a length on leg stump, looks to swat it into the leg-side but is struck on the thigh instead
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, slides past the outside edge. Stoinis is expecting the ball to turn but it goes straight on
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, no run, reckon he delivered that from behind the stump line. Length ball which Stoinis fails to get to the pitch of after shimmying down, settles for an on-side defence
Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, 95kph, flat on middle, Handscomb mistimes the punch to the straight midwicket fielder
Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, drifting in on middle, turned to short midwicket. Slowed it up there, Jadeja
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, overpitched on middle, squeezed down to long-off
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, full at the stumps, eased down to long-on
Jadeja to Handscomb, FOUR, Handscomb doesn't chance the fine sweep after the warning Dhoni gave him in the previous over. Instead, he goes harder and belts it wide of fine leg
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, clipped off the pads through square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, fails to get the sweep away from outside off, it snuck underneath him. Jadhav's low bounce proving very effective again

Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, this would've been quite sensational from Dhoni had he held on. Anticipated the paddle sweep from Handscomb, managed to shuffle across by a couple of yards to his left and that's exactly where the ball came. He even got both hands to it, but it popped out
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 2 runs, he's used this paddle-sweep quite fruitfully in this innings. Plays it nice and fine for a couple of runs
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, length ball skidding through outside off, punched to extra cover
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, bit short outside off, he's a tough customer to play the cut against and Handscomb finds extra cover
Kedar Jadhav to Stoinis, 1 run, quite round-arm, floated up on off, Stoinis pushes down to long-off
Jadeja to Stoinis, 1 run, skidding through from back of a length outside off, punched down to long-off
Jadeja to Stoinis, no run, pushed to cover
Jadeja to Stoinis, no run, stays on the back foot to a length ball and punches it to cover
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, Handscomb glances it down to fine leg

Jadeja to Stoinis, 3 runs, uncertainly pushes at a length ball that's turning away from him. It runs off a thick outside edge past slip and it'll be a big chase for point. They complete the two, and then take one on the throw
Jadeja to Stoinis, no run, drifting in on middle, defended forward
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, 1 run, flighted googly turning away outside off, Stoinis has a half-hearted bunt down to long-off

Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, no run, it's only Kuldeep who's appealing for the leg-before. Dharmasena turns it down. May have been the googly this. Tossed up on a length, pitching in line with leg stump and kicking up onto the flap of the pad. Too high maybe. Was in fact the leg-break, but it was bouncing over nevertheless
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, no run, 73.2kph, flighted up across off, turning back in, Stoinis has his bat much closer to the pad in defence
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, no run, flighted up on off, played back down the pitch
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, no run, turned to short midwicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, no run, that's gone right through the gate and probably bounced over the top of off! What a ball. Enticingly tossed up outside off, drifting away teasingly, getting Stoinis to lean across and then turning past the inside edge. Kuldeep can't believe that's missed the stumps

Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Stoinis mistimes the punch wide of cover and sets off. That is another good over from Bumrah, he's conceded two runs off his two overs in this spell
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, slower delivery and Stoinis defends into the leg-side. Five dots..
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, fuller and outside off, Stoinis pushes it past Shankar at cover, but the duo don't risk a single as Kohli is quick to swoop down from mid-off
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, oh! Slanting in and Stoinis is a tad late in bringing his bat down, jams it off the inside edge onto the pad and leaves Bumrah with his hands on his head
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, back of a length angling in, Stoinis offers a straight bat in defence
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run, on a length outside off, Stoinis toe-ends the block into the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, 1 run, googly on the shorter side and Stoinis nudges it to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run, picks the wrong 'un from outside off and paddles it round the corner - to fine leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Stoinis, 1 run, on the shorter side and it is an easy pick away for Stoinis through mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Cleaned up! First time Kuldeep has dismissed Maxwell. What a time to do it. The pressure was building and you could sense something about to give and it is the wicket of the in-form Maxwell. It was dropped short but on this surface where the bounce is uneven it is almost suicidal playing the pull, Maxwell goes for it and is done in by the lack of bounce, the ball sneaks underneath the bat to disturb the furniture. Big wicket for India. Maxwell b Kuldeep Yadav 4(18)
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, no run, shortens the length and Maxwell carves the punch to point. Pressure on..
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, no run, tossed up outside off, Maxwell drives and finds extra cover in the way
Bumrah to Handscomb, no run, short of length and Handscomb tucks it in front of mid-wicket. Brilliant over, just the single off it
Bumrah to Handscomb, no run, full and slanting in, Handscomb pushes it meekly to Kohli at cover
Bumrah to Handscomb, no run, three quarter length and Handscomb pats it towards cover, puts his hand up to send Maxwell back
Bumrah to Maxwell, 1 run, back of a length and Maxwell knocks it with soft hands in front of mid-on, Kuldeep can't stop the quick single
Bumrah to Maxwell, no run, on a length and straightening a touch, Maxwell pushes off the outer half this time, straight to cover

Bumrah to Maxwell, no run, walks down and looks to force it through the off-side, but Bumrah's angle takes the inner half and the ball rolls towards mid-wicket, where Rohit dives to his right to make the stop
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run, flighted and lands it full, Maxwell drives it down to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, no run, good work from Maxwell. It is never easy with Dhoni behind the stumps. He was beaten by the wrong 'un and the back foot was lifted for a nano second, but it came down before Dhoni could light up the stumps. Kuldeep also appealed for a caught behind but umpire Kumar Dharmasena didn't reckon there was an edge
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, no run, wrong 'un and Maxwell read it off the surface, knocks it with the turn to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run, picks a very full delivery to play the lap and gets it away somehow, single to fine leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 2 runs, flighted outside off, Handscomb under edges the paddle sweep, picks up a brace

Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, no run, appeal for an LBW from Kuldeep. Spins in sharply and Handscomb had no clue about it, he was shaping to play the back foot punch, beaten and struck on the back thigh. Spinning down leg
Jadeja to Maxwell, no run, drags the length back and Maxwell directs it with an open bat face to backward point
Jadeja to Maxwell, no run, quicker and outside off, Maxwell pushes it to the other side of Jadeja now
Jadeja to Maxwell, no run, targeting the stumps, Maxwell defends to the right of Jadeja
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, touch short and Handscomb stays leg-side to carve the punch to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, tossed up on off, Handscomb slices the drive to Shankar at cover
Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, arrowing in at the stumps, Handscomb hangs back and knocks it to cover
Shami to Maxwell, no run, back of a length, Maxwell hops up and punches it to cover

Shami to Maxwell, no run, oh! That is an excellent delivery. The dipping slow yorker, Maxwell did not pick it, he was late in spotting that and bringing his bat down, the ball sneaks past and wasn't far from the off-stump. Shami has his hands on his head
Shami to Maxwell, no run, shortens the length and Maxwell punches it back to Shami, who makes a good stop in his followthrough
Shami to Maxwell, no run, finger rolled across the ball and Maxwell opens the bat face to drive, straight to Jadeja at point
Shami to Handscomb, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Handscomb cue-ends the drive past cover
Shami to Handscomb, wide, strays down leg and Handscomb fails to connect with the glance, wide given
Shami to Maxwell, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Maxwell punches it to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Maxwell, 1 run, lands it full and allows Maxwell to drive down the ground to long-off

Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, out Caught by Dhoni!! Gone! India have a lucky breakthrough. Marsh is strangled down leg. Umpire Nitin Menon had his finger up in a flash and Marsh knew there was some wood. He started walking as soon as the decision was made. Spinning down leg, Marsh shuffles and gets inside the line, in an attempt to tickle it, he gets faint edge to Dhoni. Good grab that as it was turning sharply and there was an edge as well. Shaun Marsh c Dhoni b Jadeja 16(27)
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, no run, touch quicker and outside off, Marsh bunts it into the off-side
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, no run, fired in on the pads and Marsh misses the flick, struck on the pad and Jadeja went up. Going down
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, wristed against the spin to long-on

Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, Handscomb had never left the crease. Easy decision for Joel Wilson. That is the pace at which Jadeja has to bowl. Slower and drawing the batsman forward, Handscomb does not account for the spin and is beaten on the outside edge, Dhoni at his usual lightning best but Handscomb had his foot firmly planted
Shami to Handscomb, 1 run, back of a length around off, Handscomb taps it to the left of cover, easy single
Shami to Shaun Marsh, leg byes, 1 run, slower delivery on leg-stump, Marsh misses the flick and the ball ricochets off the pad
Shami to Handscomb, 1 run, fuller than a good length and Handscomb plays an extended forward push to sweeper cover

Shami to Handscomb, no run, uhhh! That was close to the outside edge. Zippy back of a length delivery that is too close to Handscomb to be playing the square cut, he's all cramped up and beaten on the edge
Shami to Handscomb, no run, back of a length and Handscomb blocks it to mid-on, who has been brought in
Shami to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, slower delivery and Marsh closes the bat face, the leading edge rolls past point
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, shortens the length and Marsh punches it to long-on
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, no run, quicker and outside off, Marsh is back and across to defend
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, lands it full and is driven towards extra cover, where Kohli makes a half stop and concedes the single
Jadeja to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, very full and Marsh squeezes the drive past a diving Jadeja, single to long-on
Jadeja to Handscomb, 1 run, drifts in and Handscomb uses that to wrist a single to long-on
Jadeja to Handscomb, no run, flattish and close to off, Handscomb stays back and knocks it to point
Shami to Handscomb, 1 run, on a length outside off, Handscomb opens the bat face and runs it down to third man

Shami to Handscomb, FOUR, wow! What timing! That was not a bad delivery by any margin. A yorker aimed for the base of off-stump, Handscomb squeezes it straight back past Shami and the timing is such that it keeps racing away to the fence
Shami to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, cutter outside off and Marsh has to check his forward push, plays it well in the end past cover
Shami to Handscomb, 1 run, back of a length and Handscomb cracks the square drive straight to Dhawan at sweeper cover
Shami to Handscomb, no run, fuller and around off, Handscomb pushes towards cover, where Kohli intercepts
Shami to Handscomb, no run, short of length with low bounce and Handscomb dabs it with an angled bat to backward point
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 1 run, tossed up on off, driven away to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, uses his soft hands and guides it to point
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, no run, floated outside off, Marsh'e eyes light up as he slaps it. Finds Jaddu at extra cover
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 1 run, quicker on middle, straight-batted push to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, weight forward, hands following the ball and stabs the drive to sweeper cover
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 1 run, serves it up on the pads, nurdled behind square
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run, throws it up teasingly outside off, Handscomb drills it past kuldeep, who fails to stop it
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, drags it short outside off, Marsh spanks it to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, no run, flat outside off, punched to extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run, too full from Kuldeep, worked away to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, no run, googly, Handscomb reads it off the deck and forces it to cover-point
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, soft-handed dab to cover
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 2 runs, Kedar offers a little bit of width, Handscomb gets deep and cuts it on the rise. But it's in the gap and past backward point
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, slides it on middle and leg, Marsh wrists it to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 1 run, flat outside off, Handscomb punches it uppishly to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, no run, slingy round-armer, flicked to mid-wicket
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, flatter from Kedar, Marsh skips back and blunts it down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, no run, hurls it just outside off, Marsh gets forward and quells it to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, 81.6kph, quicker on leg. Tucked away to deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run, slower and turning in, cramps Handscomb for room as he was backing away to leg. Manages to punch it to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, 1 run, poked after opening the bat face to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, 2 runs, slows it up and extracts some turn after drawing Marsh forward. Soft outside edge runs past first slip and Marsh scampers back for the second
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, no run, 77.9kph, tossed up around middle and leg. Marsh with a confident stride forward to ease it out
Kuldeep Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run, gives plenty of air, turns out to be a low full toss and Handscomb chips it airly down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, no run, arrowing in, Marsh stomps forward and kills the spin
Kedar Jadhav to Shaun Marsh, 2 runs, looped up just outside off, steered square past point and Marsh comes back for the second
Kedar Jadhav to Handscomb, 1 run, 72.9kph tossie just outside off, ends up as a half-volley and Handscomb pushes it to long-off and gets off the mark

Kedar Jadhav to Khawaja, out Caught by Kohli!! The one-brings-two phenomenon. Such a soft dismissal and Virat is all pumped like he is always. The round-armish dart outside off, Khawaja underestimated the dip there as he goes hard at it in trying to work it across the line. Comes off the leading edge and balloons up to captain Kohli at extra cover. The golden arm of Jadhav strikes for India and the visitors have lost both openers in two overs. Is this the sign of things to come? Khawaja c Kohli b Kedar Jadhav 38(37) [4s-6]
Kedar Jadhav to Khawaja, no run, slower through the air just outside off, Khawaja waits for the ball to arrive and chops it to short third man
Kedar Jadhav to Khawaja, no run, driven hard, straight to extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, no run, drops it short, Marsh goes back and punches it to extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, no run, slowish again, Marsh smothers the spin
Kuldeep Yadav to Shaun Marsh, no run, floater around off, dead-batted carefully

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, out Lbw!! So, the bowling change has worked for India and it's Kuldeep, who gets the better of Finch. The Australian captain walks up to Khawaja and has a chat, but decides to trudge off. First wicket for India and the spirited opening partnership has been broken. It was flighted too full, Finch went low for the sweep and paid the price. Wasn't the ideal shot as it was dipping as well. Gets struck low on the pad and umpire Kumar Dharmasena reckoned the impact was in-line. Finch lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 37(53) [4s-5 6s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Khawaja, 1 run, Khawaja lines up for a cut, gets too close for comfort and it strikes him on the pad first. Hence, MS went up but quickly withdrew the appeal as the impact was outside off
Kuldeep Yadav to Khawaja, no run, very well-flighted by Kuldeep, Khawaja stabs it defensively
Jadeja to Finch, no run, shortens his length, Finch judges it early and forces it off the back foot to extra cover
Jadeja to Finch, no run, straightish, solidly blocked
Jadeja to Khawaja, 1 run, Khawaja is happy to exchange ends as he bunts it away to long-on
Jadeja to Finch, 1 run, overpitched, firmly driven to long-on
Jadeja to Khawaja, 1 run, snaking in with the arm, on middle and leg. Flicked neatly in front of square on the leg-side
Jadeja to Finch, 1 run, loops up outside off, Finch checks his drive to sweeper cover
Kedar Jadhav to Finch, 1 run, push-driven to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Finch, no run, angles it wider of off, Finch jumps back and crunches it to extra cover, good diving stop from the fielder
Kedar Jadhav to Finch, no run, flatter at 84.8kph just outside off, punched to extra cover
Kedar Jadhav to Finch, no run, this was much slower, but the line is on leg. Tickled to square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Finch, no run, straighter again, clipped to mid-wicket
Kedar Jadhav to Finch, no run, Jadhav begins with his side-arm darter, Finch watchfully defends it off the front foot
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, 1 run, tucked away through square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, no run, gets near the pitch, had to make some adjustment and keeps his bat close to his pad in defence

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, no run, stifled appeal for lbw, not a very convincing one and shake of the head from the umpire. Tosses it just outside off, Finch moves across to sweep and plays it down the wrong line. Gets hit on the back thigh and it's clearly missing the stumps
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, no run, beaten. Googly from Kuldeep, Finch was playing for the chinaman and it just missed the outside edge
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, no run, floated just outside off, Finch allows the ball to spin and smothers it under his nose
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, right, Finch doesn't want to let Kuldeep settle here. Spots a flighted delivery and off he goes down in time to slog it witheringly over mid-wicket. Monster hit!
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, wide, not the start he would've wanted. Spins it down leg and it's been called a wide
Jadeja to Khawaja, 2 runs, turned with a closed bat-face through square leg. Plenty of gaps on the leg-side and Khawaja races back for the second
Jadeja to Khawaja, wide, slips it down leg, Khawaja looks to employ the sweep but misses it
Jadeja to Khawaja, no run, wristed with the spin to mid-wicket

Jadeja to Khawaja, FOUR, intentionally done. Bumrah gives up the chase and it'll be a boundary to Khawaja. Quicker just outside off, Khawaja waits and opens his bat face, in the process gets a soft outside edge which runs through the vacant first slip region
Jadeja to Finch, 1 run, Jadeja overpitches it just outside off, Finch drives it to long-off
Jadeja to Finch, no run, flighted just outside off, gentle push to extra cover
Jadeja to Khawaja, 1 run, the trajectory is flat, so Khawaja dinks it to the left of point
Shankar to Finch, no run, back of a length around off stump, punched off the back foot towards Shankar

Shankar to Finch, FOUR, cheeky from Finch! Third boundary of the over. Third man up and Shankar provides a hint of width. That's enough for Finch who opens the bat face late to get it wide of that fielder
Shankar to Finch, no run, closer to the off pole, cramps Finch who chops it towards backward point
Shankar to Finch, FOUR, bam! Finch will be delighted to get freebies like this. Gentle lwo full toss and it's slammed straight back past the bowler. Well wide of mid-off who had no chance
Shankar to Khawaja, 1 run, fuller and wider outside off, driven off the front foto towards deep point

Shankar to Khawaja, FOUR, the 'erring on the pads' syndrome continues from India's bowlers. Shankar is the latest culprit, begins with a loosener that Khawaja works wide of short fine leg to pick up a boundary. This is a brilliant start for the Aussies
Jadeja to Finch, no run, fuller and outside off, driven towards the man at extra cover who stops it
Jadeja to Finch, FOUR, spilled on the pads, all the Indian bowlers have erred this way so far. Finch gets a tiny tickle on it down to the fine leg fence
Jadeja to Finch, no run, flatter and fuller on off, jammed down the track and Jadeja gets across. Nearly bumping into Khawaja
Jadeja to Khawaja, 1 run, fuller and around off, worked away towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Jadeja to Khawaja, FOUR, smart batting! With the ball spinning in, the loft over mid-wicket is a minimum risk shot, particularly with nobody sweeping. Khawaja connects the whip stroke well and clears the infield with ease
Jadeja to Khawaja, no run, drops it short and wide outside off, Khawaja can't beat point with the cut
Bumrah to Finch, no run, fuller and outside off, Finch leans forward and pats it towards cover
Bumrah to Khawaja, 1 run, fuller and around middle, wristed to the left of mid-on. Rayudu pulls off a superb stop
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, fuller and outside off, Khawaja pushes at it with no footwork and get lucky not to nick it
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, on a length just around off stump, mistimed drive back towards Bumrah

Bumrah to Khawaja, FOUR, finds the gap this time! Slower ball from Bumrah but it's on the pads again. Khawaja doesn't miss out, clips it behind square leg and with this outfield, no chance for fine leg to cut it off
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, good shot but can't find the gap. Was fed on the pads and Khawaja flicked it stylishly, straight to square leg
Jadeja to Finch, no run, flighted fuller outside off, good stride forward from Finch as he smothers it
Jadeja to Finch, no run, fuller and around middle, nudged with soft hands to mid-wicket
Jadeja to Finch, no run, flatter and around off, skids on, defended back to the bowler
Jadeja to Finch, no run, sharp turn! Just what Jadeja needs early in a spell, a ball to turn. This spins away from a good length and Finch gets beaten on the back foot push
Jadeja to Finch, no run, slightly short and outside off, punched off the back foot towards cover
Jadeja to Khawaja, 1 run, slower and a hint of turn from outside off, nudged towards backward square leg
Bumrah to Finch, no run, angling in on middle and leg, blocked off the back foot to mid-wicket
Bumrah to Finch, no run, short of a length outside off, goes on the bounce to Dhoni again. Finch misses a waft
Bumrah to Khawaja, leg byes, 1 run, fuller and angling in on leg stump, Khawaja is on the move and shuffles to flick but misses. Off the pads down to fine leg
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, how did that miss the stumps? Terrific slower ball from Bumrah, deceived Khawaja all ends up as he tried to keep it out. Narrowly missed the off pole en route to the keeper

Bumrah to Khawaja, FOUR, nicely done! Khawaja is a treat to watch when he executes shots, especially off the back foot. This is a touch short from Bumrah and the southpaw picks it early, latching onto the pull over square leg. Clean strike
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, shortish and around off stump, worked off the back foot to mid-wicket
Shami to Finch, no run, good ball and equally well played. Was a sharp inswinger from around off stump, Finch played around the front pad but importantly, dealt with a straight bat towards mid-on
Shami to Finch, no run, fuller and outside off, driven off the front foot to mid-off
Shami to Finch, wide, loses his radar again and ends up feeding it well down the leg-side. Another wide
Shami to Finch, no run, on that hard length again outside off, punched off the back foot to short cover
Shami to Finch, no run, shortish again on middle and leg, worked off the back foot towards square leg
Shami to Finch, no run, short of a length outside off, stabbed off the back foot towards cover
Shami to Khawaja, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Khawaja rides the bounce and steers it fine towards third man. Bumrah gets across swiftly to prevent the second run

Bumrah to Finch, FOUR, edged but well wide of first slip! Don't think it would have carried anyway. Was the fuller length again, inducing a lazy drive from Finch, only to get the nick that raced away fine to the third man fence. So far, seems like Finch is having the luck that he needs in this rough patch
Bumrah to Finch, no run, fuller and slanting in from just outside off, defended solidly off the front foot towards cover
Bumrah to Finch, no run, play and a miss! Bumrah continues to probe away, straightened after pitching, this in-angler with plenty of bounce. Finch just pushed tamely at it with no footwork
Bumrah to Khawaja, 1 run, short of a length around off stump, Khawaja shuffles a bit and short-arm jabs it down to fine leg

Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, past the edge again, kept low too! Slanting in around off, Khawaja pushed inside the line with no footwork and this sneaked beneath his bat. On the bounce to Dhoni. Not what the chasing side will want to see so early

Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, round the wicket goes Bumrah and nearly finds the edge straightaway. Angled it in from outside off and straightened just a bit, Khawaja hung his bat at it and is fortunate not to get an edge
Shami to Finch, no run, on a good length well outside off, shapes further away as Finch lets it go
Shami to Finch, 2 runs, angling into the pads from a good length, Finch shuffles a bit to tuck this towards deep backward square leg. Easy two by the time fine leg tidies up
Shami to Finch, no run, on a good length closer to off stump, Finch sits back and defends it well towards cover
Shami to Finch, no run, just past the edge! Shortens the length wider outside off, Finch chases with a nervy poke sans any foot movement

Shami to Finch, FOUR, creamed! This kind of a shot will soothe Finch who has had a torrid time of late. On a length with some width on offer, he reached out to ease the drive on the up. Found the gap at cover and it raced away
Shami to Finch, wide, doesn't seem like Shami is finding the rhythm. He's getting movement of course but not on target, yet. Spills this well down the leg-side
Shami to Finch, no run, back of a length outside off, keeps a shade low and Finch defends off the back foot
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, angling across Khawaja from a good length, he waves his bat to let it pass
Bumrah to Khawaja, no run, on a good length around off stump, defended off the back foot towards point

Bumrah to Finch, 3 runs, almost! Almost had his man. After a series of outswingers, Bumrah opts for the searing inswinger that Finch dreads. Manages to get his bat down in time to jab this through mid-wicket. Kedar gave a good chase and did well to just about haul it in. Saves a run

Bumrah to Finch, no run, beats the edge! On a length outside off, tempts Finch into the drive and he falls for it this time but is deceived by the late outward movement. Perfectly bowled, just that it didn't find the nick
Bumrah to Finch, no run, full this time and on the probing fourth stump channel, watchfully left alone
Bumrah to Finch, wide, another outswinger attempt gone wrong as Bumrah spills this wide outside off. Finch went chasing but couldn't connect

Bumrah to Finch, no run, better! Can get straighter in line though. Was on a good length and it straightened with extra bounce. Finch could have left it alone but nearly had a poke at it. Almost replayed the dismissal from the previous game
Bumrah to Finch, wide, like Shami, Bumrah also begins with a wide. Was searching for the outswinger maybe I reckon but fed it well outside off
Shami to Khawaja, FOUR, not a good beginning for Shami in this first over. Another one on the pads, Khawaja just gets inside the line a bit and tickles it down to the fine leg fence
Shami to Khawaja, no run, wider line this time, far outside off and it's a comfortable leave for Khawaja
Shami to Khawaja, no run, on the money this time, around the off stump with a bit of extra bounce. Khawaja defends by getting right behind the line
Shami to Khawaja, no run, the away angler, on a good length with extra bounce as Khawaja drags his bat inside the line

Shami to Khawaja, 2 runs, sprayed on the pads, on a good length and Khawaja hangs back to flick this through backward square leg. Fine leg is a touch fine and has a bit of ground to cover, which he does
Shami to Finch, 1 run, short of a length, angling into Finch who tucks it down towards fine leg
Shami to Finch, wide, erratic delivery to begin with from Shami, sprays it way down leg and Dhoni does well to get across
